dialogue_metadata.inferred_relationship: Friends or colleagues discussing current events.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god, the Houston consulate thing? Firefighters outside, diplomats torching documents inside? What a joke. Like, strong TV drama, they called it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god, the Houston consulate thing? Firefighters outside, diplomats torching documents inside? What a joke. Like, strong T V drama, they called it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: News of the expulsions featured firefighters outside the building in Houston as diplomats torched documents inside the complexs courtyard. Strong TV drama.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, wait. It's not a joke, though. I mean, Rubio, right? The hardliner, he was saying it's like, a spy network hub. But then privately, he told the White House aide he was worried the intel gained would be devastating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, wait. It's not a joke, though. I mean, Rubio, right? The hardliner, he was saying it's like, a spy network hub. But then privately, he told the White House aide he was worried the intel gained would be devastating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hardline U.S. Senator Marco Rubio proclaimed that the site was the central node in the Communist Partys vast network of spies and influence operations in the United States.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, devastating to, like, his election campaign, maybe. I don't know. It's an election year, right? Suddenly, now we notice China?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, devastating to, like, his election campaign, maybe. I don't know. It's an election year, right? Suddenly, now we notice China?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: How come no one noticed until it was an election year?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the documents, though. Think about it. American spooks want to know what they burned. And a source, anonymously, said it was probably a secret list of American assets in China. Gone. Poof.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the documents, though. Think about it. American spooks want to know what they burned. And a source, anonymously, said it was probably a secret list of American assets in China. Gone. Poof.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: American spooks would like to know what documents Chinese officials burned after being ordered out of the country with just 72 hours notice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. A secret list. So, like, they just happened to have this super important secret list right there to burn, and now it's gone forever? Convenient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. A secret list. So, like, they just happened to have this super important secret list right there to burn, and now it's gone forever? Convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's not convenient. It's, um, it shows a shift. This whole "wolf-warrior" diplomacy, you know? Xi Jinping, he's totally throwing out the old Deng Xiaoping idea of, like, "bide your time."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's not convenient. It's, um, it shows a shift. This whole wolf-warrior diplomacy, you know? Xi Jinping, he's totally throwing out the old Deng Xiaoping idea of, like, bide your time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nobody told Chinas president, Xi Jinping, or his wolf-warrior diplomats to be patient. ... Whatever happened to Deng Xiaopings dictum that China should bide its time and hide its strength? ... Yet Xi has effectively thrown Deng onto the dust heap of history...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the bide your time thing. Everyone always talks about that. So what? China's, uh, being more aggressive? Again?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the bide your time thing. Everyone always talks about that. So what? China's, uh, being more aggressive? Again?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it's different now! He's, like, actually goading countries around the region to resist them. He's making multiple enemies, right? Sinking Vietnamese fishing boats, clashing with India. It's, um, it's neo-Maoist, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's different now! He's, like, actually goading countries around the region to resist them. He's making multiple enemies, right? Sinking Vietnamese fishing boats, clashing with India. It's, um, it's neo-Maoist, really.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, he is goading countries around the region to resist China. ... Never since the 1949 establishment of the Peoples Republic of China has the country taken on multiple enemies, as it has done this year. Whether its sinking Vietnamese fishing boats or clashing with Indian troops... Yet Xi has effectively thrown Deng onto the dust heap of history, reaching back to the past in nurturing his neo-Maoist policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Neo-Maoist. Right. And they can't joke about Winnie the Pooh. That's, uh, that's what we're worried about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Neo-Maoist. Right. And they can't joke about Winnie the Pooh. That's, uh, that's what we're worried about.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its hard to see how China can build a creative and dynamic economy when people arent allowed to joke about Winnie the Pooh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No! It's not just Winnie the Pooh. It's the smothering of dissent. Hong Kong, blank sheets of paper, arresting people for that! After, like, they solemnly agreed to a mini-Constitution guaranteeing freedom of speech there. It's, uh, it's a pattern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! It's not just Winnie the Pooh. It's the smothering of dissent. Hong Kong, blank sheets of paper, arresting people for that! After, like, they solemnly agreed to a mini-Constitution guaranteeing freedom of speech there. It's, uh, it's a pattern.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The hammering of Hong Kong is yet more evidence of the urge to smother dissent... Arresting people for holding up blank sheets of paper after threatening them under the new National Security Law, as happened in a shopping mall recently? Really? In a place where China solemnly agreed to a mini-Constitution guaranteeing freedom of speech?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Look, it's, uh, it's still their internal stuff, mostly. I mean, here in the US, what does it really change?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Look, it's, uh, it's still their internal stuff, mostly. I mean, here in the U S, what does it really change?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What does it change? Okay, so think of it as a ratchet, right? That's what the article said. It only goes one direction. Tighter. Both sides, um, the US and China, are taking turns ratcheting up the pressure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What does it change? Okay, so think of it as a ratchet, right? That's what the article said. It only goes one direction. Tighter. Both sides, um, the U S and China, are taking turns ratcheting up the pressure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Think of Sino-U.S. relations now as a ratchet. A ratchet only goes one directiontighter. China and the U.S. are taking turns ratcheting up the pressure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, yeah, I get it. Tensions are high. Accidents happen. Like, uh, history class, WWI, "sleepwalkers" stumbling into war.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, yeah, I get it. Tensions are high. Accidents happen. Like, uh, history class, W W I, sleepwalkers stumbling into war.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Historian Christopher Clarks The Sleepwalkers portrays a half-awake Europe stumbling into the horror of World War I. Much has been written comparing the world that Clark describes with the brewing Sino-U.S. conflict.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Remember that Chinese pilot who collided with the US spy plane in 2001? The Chinese pilot was killed, the US air crew captured. That, um, that was resolved peacefully. But it's hard to believe we would be so fortunate today.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Remember that Chinese pilot who collided with the U S spy plane in two thousand one? The Chinese pilot was killed, the U S air crew captured. That, um, that was resolved peacefully. But it's hard to believe we would be so fortunate today.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2001 a Chinese pilot collided with a U.S. spy plane, which made an emergency landing on Hainan Island. The Chinese pilot was killed while the U.S. air crew was captured. That dramatic incident was resolved peacefully. Its hard to believe that we would be so fortunate today.
